intro: Dipcadi rupicola, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its erect, leafy stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with six petals that are fused at the base. Dipcadi rupicola is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological significance.
